rules.natural: Provided that John’s test for influenza is accurate, it is not the case that John has a false positive for influenza.
Whenever Mary is a carrier of influenza, Mary is asymptomatic for influenza.
Either the influenza outbreak is contained, or influenza is a seasonal outbreak.
Under the condition that a vaccine is available for influenza, the outbreak is not contained.
A vaccine is available for influenza, or the community has herd immunity.
Provided that John is symptomatic with influenza, John is infected with influenza.
Either travel restrictions are in place for influenza, or social distancing measures are enforced for influenza.
Under the condition that social distancing measures are enforced for influenza, influenza is not a pandemic.
The community is under lockdown, or, if travel restrictions are in place for influenza, then influenza is not a pandemic.
Whenever clinical trials are underway for influenza, research is ongoing for influenza.
Clinical trials are underway for influenza, or drug development is proceeding for influenza.
Under the condition that drug development is proceeding for influenza, an antiviral has been discovered for influenza.
Provided that treatment is successful for influenza, there is no vaccine failure for influenza.
If John has a fever, then John is symptomatic with influenza.
Research funding has been cut, or, if it is not the case that an antiviral discovery implies that non-seasonal outbreak leads to treatment availability, then treatment is successful for influenza.
Whenever influenza transmission has stopped, the outbreak is not contained.
If the community is cooperating with public health measures, then, provided that the community has herd immunity, influenza transmission has stopped.
The community is cooperating with public health measures, or the government is intervening in the community.
Under the condition that the government is intervening in the community, if the community has herd immunity, then influenza transmission has stopped.
Whenever surveillance is active in the community, contact tracing is being conducted in the community.
Provided that contact tracing is being conducted in the community, testing is widespread in the community.
Under the condition that testing is widespread in the community, early detection is occurring in the community.
If early detection is occurring in the community, then, provided that either a mutation has not occurred or the outbreak is not contained, influenza is not vaccine-resistant.
If John has a cough, then John has a fever.

If WHO has issued alerts for influenza, then, under the condition that there is no international cooperation or no ongoing research or non-seasonal outbreak implies treatment availability, influenza has not spread globally.
WHO has issued alerts for influenza, or the CDC is responding to influenza.
If the CDC is responding to influenza, then emergency funds are allocated for influenza.

Under the condition that emergency funds are allocated for influenza, if there is no international cooperation or no ongoing research or non-seasonal outbreak implies treatment availability, then influenza has not spread globally.

If there has been a scientific breakthrough for influenza, then, under the condition that it is not the case that an antiviral discovery implies that non-seasonal outbreak leads to treatment availability, treatment is successful for influenza.
Provided that the research is peer-reviewed, if medical research is being conducted on influenza, then there has been a scientific breakthrough for influenza.
If preliminary findings have been released for the research, then, whenever medical research is being conducted on influenza, there has been a scientific breakthrough for influenza.
The study is published, or a preprint is available for the research.
If a preprint is available for the research, then preliminary findings have been released for the research.
Provided that phase 1 of the trials is complete, if drug development is proceeding for influenza, then, whenever influenza is not a seasonal outbreak, a treatment is available for influenza.

If phase 2 of the trials is complete, then, under the condition that drug development is proceeding for influenza, provided that influenza is not a seasonal outbreak, a treatment is available for influenza.
Whenever the treatment has emergency authorization, the treatment is FDA-approved.
The treatment has been recalled, or the treatment is safe, or the treatment does not have side effects.
If an alternative treatment exists for influenza, then the treatment has not been recalled.
An alternative treatment exists for influenza, or a traditional remedy is used for influenza.
Provided that a traditional remedy is used for influenza, the treatment has not been recalled.
John tested positive for influenza, or John is a confirmed case of influenza.
If John is a confirmed case of influenza, then, under the condition that it is not the case that non-seasonal outbreak leads to quarantine implies hospitalization, John has recovered.
Provided that it is not the case that Mary being contagious implies she was not exposed, Mary is a carrier of influenza.
If it is not the case that herd immunity implies the outbreak is not contained, then influenza is a pandemic.
Under the condition that it is not the case that an antiviral discovery implies that non-seasonal outbreak leads to treatment availability, there is vaccine failure for influenza.
Provided that it is not the case that either a mutation has occurred or the outbreak is not contained, influenza is vaccine-resistant.
Under the condition that it is not the case that there is international cooperation or ongoing research or non-seasonal outbreak implies treatment availability, influenza has spread globally.
If it is not the case that the study being published implies it is peer-reviewed, then the study has been retracted.
Provided that it is not the case that the study being published implies it is peer-reviewed, the study has not been retracted.

rules.prover9_expression: (-(tested_positive(john, influenza) -> (-(-(-seasonal_outbreak(influenza) -> quarantined(john)) -> hospitalized(john)) -> recovered(john))) -> false_positive(john, influenza))
rules.natural: Provided that it is not the case that John testing positive implies that non-quarantine due to non-seasonal outbreak implies hospitalization leads to recovery, John has a false positive for influenza.

rules.prover9_expression: (-(tested_positive(john, influenza) -> (-(-(-seasonal_outbreak(influenza) -> quarantined(john)) -> hospitalized(john)) -> recovered(john))) -> accurate_test(john, influenza))
rules.natural: If it is not the case that John testing positive implies that non-quarantine due to non-seasonal outbreak implies hospitalization leads to recovery, then John's test for influenza was accurate.
If it is not the case that non-completion of phase 1 or phase 2 implies emergency authorization, then the treatment has side effects.
If it is not the case that non-quarantine due to non-seasonal outbreak implies hospitalization, then John has not recovered.
If it is not the case that non-seasonal outbreak leads to quarantine, then John is not hospitalized.
Provided that influenza is not a seasonal outbreak, Mary was exposed to influenza.
If influenza is not a seasonal outbreak, then Mary is contagious with influenza.
Whenever influenza is not a seasonal outbreak, John has a cough.
Provided that influenza is not a seasonal outbreak, a treatment is not available for influenza.
